sen.j: 宮内卿（くない-きょう）または後鳥羽院宮内卿（ごとば/ごとばの-いん・くない-きょう）は、新古今期を代表する女房歌人。
sen.e: Kunaikyo or Gotoba/Gotobanoin Kunaikyo was a court-lady poet who represented a period when Sinkokin (Wakashu) (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) was made.
Kunaikyo or Gotoba/Gotobanoin Kunaikyo was a court-lady poet who is representative of a period when Shinkokin (Wakashu, or New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) was made.
sen.cmt: 「represented」→「is representative of」, 「Sinkokin」→「Shinkokin」, 「)(」→「, or」
sen.e: Kunaikyo or Gotoba/Gotobanoin Kunaikyo was a court-lady poet who is representative of a period when Shinkokin (Wakashu, or New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) was compiled.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 新三十六歌仙、女房三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: She was one of the New Thirty-six Major Poets and the Thirty-six Immortal Lady Poets.

sen.e: She is one of the New Thirty-six Major Poets as well as one of the Thirty-six Immortal Lady Poets.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一般には宮内卿とされることが多いが、同名の女房歌人と区別するために、特に後鳥羽院と冠することもある（『玉葉集』など）。
sen.e: She is generally known as Kunaikyo, but sometimes called especially Gotobain Kunaikyo to distinguish her from the other court-lady poet who had the same name as hers ("Gyokuyo shu" etc.).
She is generally known as Kunaikyo, but sometimes specifically referred to as Gotobain Kunaikyo to distinguish her from another court-lady poet of the same name ("Gyokuyo shu" etc.).
sen.cmt: 「called especially」→「specifically referred to as」, 「the other」→「another」,「who had the same name as hers」→「of the same name」
sen.e: She is generally known as Kunaikyo, but sometimes specifically referred to as Gotobain Kunaikyo to distinguish her from another court-lady poet of the same name ("Gyokuyo shu" and so on).

sen.e: It is generally considered that she died young, at the age a little over twenty.

sen.e: Her father was Ukyo Gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Western Capital Offices) MINAMOTO no Moromitsu (a son of Dainagon (Chief Councillor of State) MINAMOTO no Moroyori), and her mother was Goshirakawain Nyobo (court lady) Aki.

sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その生涯についてはほとんどはっきりしたことがわからないが、その歌才によって後鳥羽院の召しにあい院のもとに女房として出仕した。

sen.e: Although little of her life is clearly known, she was invited to the Imperial Court by Gotobain due to her outstanding talent for composing poems, then she served there as a court lady.

sen.j: 正治二年（1200年）の正治後度百首、建仁元年（1201年）の老若五十首歌合、通親亭影供歌合、撰歌合、仙洞句題五十首、千五百番歌合、同二年（1202年）の仙洞影供歌合、水無瀬恋十五首歌合などに詠進・出詠している。
sen.e: She joined various utaawase (poetry contest): in 1200, Shojigodohyakushu; in 1201, Ronyaku gojusshu utaawase, Michichikatei eigu utaawase, Sen utaawase, Sentokudai gojisshu, and Sengohyaku ban Utaawase (One thousand and five hundreds Set of Poetry Match); in 1202, Sentoeigu Utaawase and Minase koijugoshu Utaawase.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She joined various utaawase (poetry contests): in 1200, Shojigodohyakushu, in 1201, Ronyaku gojusshu utaawase, Michichikatei eigu utaawase, Sen utaawase, Sentokudai gojisshu, and Sengohyaku ban Utaawase (One Thousand Five Hundred Sets of Poetry Match), and in 1202, Sentoeigu Utaawase and Minase koijugoshu Utaawase.
sen.cmt: 「contest」→「contests」, 「;」→「,」x2, 「thousand and five hundreds Set」→「Thousand Five Hundred Sets」, 「, and」挿入
sen.e: She was entered various poetry contests: in 1200, Shojigodohyakushu (the second poetry contest in 1200), in 1201, Ronyaku gojusshu uta-awase (poetry contest by 50 poems by young and old poets), Michichikatei eigu uta-awase (poetry contest at Michichika residence, dedicated to KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro), Sen uta-awase (poetry contest in wakasho (the Office of Waka) gathering by Gotobain in 1201), Sentokudai gojisshu (poetry contest of 50 poems by 6 poets gathering by Gotobain in 1201), and Sengohyaku ban uta-awase (One Thousand Five Hundred Sets of Poetry Match), and in 1202, Sentoeigu uta-awase (poetry contest at Toba Jonan-ji Temple dedicated to KAKINOMOTO no Hitomaro) and Minase koijugoshu uta-awase (poetry contest at Minase).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 正治後度百首は後鳥羽院近臣の新人歌人を中心に詠進したものであるから、宮内卿の出仕は正治二年の直前と思われる。
sen.e: Because those who joined the Shojigodohyakushu were mainly new poets of Gotobain's trusted vassals, it is considered that Kunaikyo began to attend at the court right before 1200.

Because those who presented poems to the court for the Shojigodohyakushu were mainly new poets from Gotobain's trusted vassals, it is considered that Kunaikyo began to attend at the court just before 1200.
sen.cmt: 「joined」→「presented poems to the court for」, 「of」→「from」
sen.e: Because those who presented poems to the court for the Shojigodohyakushu were mainly new poets from Gotobain's trusted vassals, it is considered that Kunaikyo first attended at the court just before 1200.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: また現在判明している歌作でもっとも時代が新しいのは元久元年（1204年）11月の春日社歌合であり、『増鏡』などの記述から、この後遠からずして亡くなったものと推測することができる。
sen.e: Among her poems which are known today, the latest poem was made at Kasugasha Utaawase held in November, 1204, and the descriptions in "Masukagami" (The Clear Mirror) and so on suggest that she passed away soon after the utaawase.

Among those of her poems which still exist today, the latest poem was made at Kasugasha Utaawase held in November, 1204, and the descriptions in "Masukagami" (The Clear Mirror) and other poems suggest that she passed away soon after the utaawase.

sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 鴨長明『無名抄』では宮内卿を「昔にも恥じぬ上手」と評し、「あまり歌を深く案じて病になりて」重篤に陥ったが、父の諌めをも聞かずに歌にうちこんだため早世した、という逸話を紹介している。
sen.e: KAMO no Chomei commented in "Mumyosho" (an essay on tanka poetry) that 'Kunaikyo is good at composing poems and can face the great poets in the past without embarrassment,' introducing an anecdote which says 'she pondered poems so deeply that she fell sick' and got worse, but she turned a deaf ear to the protests of her father, devoting herself to poetry, so she died young.

KAMO no Chomei commented in "Mumyosho" (an essay on tanka poetry) that 'Kunaikyo is good at composing poems and can face the great poets in the past without embarrassment,' introducing an anecdote which says 'she pondered poems so deeply that she fell sick' and got worse, but she turned a deaf ear to the protests of her father, devoting herself to poetry, and died young.
sen.cmt: 「so she」→「and」
sen.e: KAMO no Chomei commented in "Mumyosho" (an essay on tanka poetry) that 'Kunaikyo is good at composing poems and can face the great poets in the past without embarrassment,' referring to an episode that 'she pondered poems so deeply that she fell sick' and got worse, but she turned a deaf ear to the protests of her father, devoting herself to poetry, and died young.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 『正徹物語』にも「宮内卿は廿よりうちになくなりにしかば」とあって、彼女が夭折したことは、中世期にひろく知られていた事実らしい。
sen.e: "Shotetsu monogatari" (Tale of Shotetsu) also states that 'Kunaikyo died under twenty,' so her early death seems to have been widely known during the medieval period.
"Shotetsu monogatari" (Tale of Shotetsu) also states that 'Kunaikyo died under twenty,' so her early death seems to have been widely known during the medieval period.

sen.j: このほか典拠不明ながら、『古今著聞集』には甥と通じていたものの、後に男の通いが絶えて憂悶に苦しんだとする逸話を掲げている。
sen.e: Other than this, "Kokon Chomon ju" (A Collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present) tells that she had an affair with her niece, but later he stopped visiting her so she experienced anguish.

sen.j: 現在まで300首前後の歌しか伝わっていない（『新古今集』に15首、『玉葉集』に9首など、計43首が勅撰集に入撰）。

sen.e: The colored leaves of autumn are like brocade. I wonder if the stormy wind broke this memento of autumn. At Mt. Tatsuta, a mountain wind seems to be blowing against the branches on which the leaves are still remaining (Shin Kokinshu).
